attributes.action: Update Psychiatric Diagnosis Procedures so they are accountable & evidence-based
attributes.background: Psychiatry is under criticism for its subjectivity and unaccountability.Brief crises are defined as lifelong conditions.There is no recognition of this ambiguity.Complaints are seen as symptoms.Patients are misunderstood or slandered.The pessimism of working in a Hospital causes Confirmation Bias.

attributes.action: Cyclists to display identification such as a number plate for accountability
attributes.background:
I believe because cyclists have anonymity some  ignore the Highway Code, creating a danger to themselves, other road users and pedestrians
I have witnessed numerous dangerous, reckless and ignorant actions
Identification and accountability could make the roads a safer place.
attributes.additional_details:
To reduce the risk cyclists present to themselves and others. Through accountability  to create a culture of best practice.
In an age of speed cameras and dashboard cams to make the cyclist identifiable when involved or causing incidents.
To promote greater harmony between the motorist and cyclist. To make the roads a safer place for pedestrians.

attributes.action: Approve TfL's October 2016 plan to transfer management of suburban rail to TfL.
attributes.background: Users of London's suburban rail services deserve a better service. They deserve more reliable, faster, more frequent trains with increased capacity, as proposed by TfL: https://tfl.gov.uk/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/developing-the-rail-network#on-this-page-1
attributes.additional_details: It's been reported today (23/11/2016) that DfT wants joint working between TfL and the rail companies, not takeovers. The rail companies have had years to improve their services, but have failed to do so. The time for second chances has long passed and rail users need to see change and improvements urgently.

attributes.action: Remove all tolls from the River Mersey.
attributes.background: The River Mersey will end up with 2 bridges and x2 tunnels that will be tolled in the next 12 months. The cost of the build, upkeep and repair of these huge national infrastructures have been given to the people of Merseyside. Who pays for the upkeep of the bridges & tunnels of The River Thames.
attributes.additional_details:
The bridges & tunnels are part of the national infrastructure and should not be the responsibility of the people of Merseyside in the same way the bridge to Skye is not theirs to pay for, the Bridges of The Thames are not purely for the people of London.
there are many roads, bridges & tunnels that are paid for nationally including the upkeep, I feel the same should be done on Merseyside.

attributes.action: To get the NHS to give cancer patients full body screening yearly
attributes.background: I would like the NHS change the way the NHS screen for cancer. I have lost Family members to cancer including my Dad. I myself am living with cancer and it scares me to death for myself and my 7 year old daughter who needs me here to be her mum. I want full screening every year for cancer patients.
attributes.additional_details: In my experience cancer does come back  and quite often in a different area. This is why I feel it is important for all past and present cancer patients to receive a full body screening every year. I had a ovarian tumour removed in 2012 now in 2016 I have bowel cancer, I did receive yearly bloods targeted in pelvic area and the bowel cancer wasn't found. I feel by having full body screening yearly could save more lives, and less invasive treatment.

attributes.action: Ban the practice of 'crossing the floor' by an elected member of parliament.
attributes.background: The practice of 'crossing the floor' in Parliament is dishonest and is a betrayal of the constituents who voted for a particular MP. If an MP wishes to either join a different party or form a new one he should announce his intention and immediately resign his seat in order to stand in a by-election.

attributes.action: Upgrade the A34 to modern 3 lane motorway standards.
attributes.background: The A34 is a very busy dual carriageway carrying ever increasing levels of traffic between the Midlands and down to the South Coast. The road was built for a bygone era and is no longer fit for purpose. There have now been numerous fatalities and serious accidents on this road in recent times.
attributes.additional_details: With the exception of the Newbury Bypass and the improved junction with the M4, the rest of the road from the M40 all the way down to Winchester was constructed in the 1970s. Bends, gradients, junctions and sight lines are not up to modern standards. The solution would be to widen and totally reconstruct the road, realigning it where necessary. If needed, funds could be found by not spending Â£900+ million earmarked for making the M4 around Reading a "smart motorway". The A34 is much more urgent.

attributes.action: Save our Fishermen: Lobby for our fishermen to be allowed to gill net for bass.
attributes.background: We are calling on George Eustice, the UK Fisheries Minister, to reject the Commission's proposals and not to cave in to angling lobbyist.  A lot of our struggling small boat commercial fishermen (under 10âs) depend on netting sea bass to keep their businesses afloat.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is retained
attributes.background:
The government is considering ending this
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension every year by the higher of inflation, average earnings or a minimum of 2.5%.
This is essential to ensure the poorest of retired people can manage in winter

attributes.action: Make ATOS and other related companies ask for claimants signature on reports
attributes.background: ATOS and related companies providing PIP and ESA assessments should have their assessor gain the claimants signature when filing a report for a capability assessment. This in turn would stop assessors lying in there reports which has been a well known fact for quite some time now.

attributes.action: Ensure the Pfizer and Flynn Pharma CMA fines are used solely to improve NHS care
attributes.background: Pharmaceutical companies Pfizer and Flynn Pharma have been fined a total of Â£89.4m by the Competition and Marketing Authority for exploiting a monopoly position over the marketing of the epilepsy drug Epanutin. Their actions have cost the NHS an estimated Â£44m per year for the last 4 years.
attributes.additional_details: The cost of this scandal has been entirely born by the NHS, and if all the fines are returned to the NHS it will still fall short of the Â£176m extra the NHS has had to pay for this vital drug. Patients with epilepsy have been most affected, and so some of the money should be used to employ Epilepsy Nurses to improve epilepsy care. See https://binscombedoctorblog.wordpress.com/2012/10/06/the-marketing-of-epanutin-re-energising-a-product-for-an-underserved-population-or-big-pharma-behaving-badly/

attributes.action: Debate if "Safe Standing" could be introduced to all seater stadia in England
attributes.background:
The most impactful recommendation of the Taylor report in 1989 was the requirement that all football stadia in the top two divisions of English football had to be all seater. 

Large numbers of fans still stand at football matches and would like to continue to do this in a safe and legal manner.
attributes.additional_details:
Taylor report - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taylor_Report

Safe standing article (admittedly with a rail seat firm) - http://www.joe.co.uk/sport/safe-standing-qa/91188

Safe Standing facts from the Football Supporters Federation - http://www.fsf.org.uk/campaigns/safe-standing/safe-standing-facts/

attributes.action: No new trade deals with China until they stop forced organ harvesting
attributes.background: Doctors Against Forced Organ Harvesting (DAFOH) have estimated between 100,000 and 200,000 Falun Gong practitioners have been subjected to forced organ harvesting since 2000.
attributes.additional_details: Constant persecution, torture and imprisonment of religious followers is contrary to the values of the right to human life that we hold dear in the United Kingdom. We implore you to insist that any trade deals between the CCP and the UK are conditional on an end to forced organ harvesting and any form of oppression towards religious followers.

attributes.action: Make lumacaftor and ivacaftor available on the NHS for cystic fibrosis patients
attributes.background: I have a daughter with cystic fibrosis who has this awful disease for the rest of her life, doctors have found a new drug that helps the mucus thin and more easy to pass, mucus being the main factor of the disease,  but the government will not make this drug available as it is too expensive
attributes.additional_details: But they will make methadone available for the use of heroin addicts. Heroin addicts who choose to take this drug, methadone costs the NHS 1billion a year, these drugs that will help cystic fibrosis patients dramatically cost a mere 80million more than methadone. Thanks

attributes.action: Create an Independent Body to regulate Speedway Clubs and Teams
attributes.background: Currently Speedway is run by the British Speedway Promotors Association, however we feel that this body of people are not running the Speedway sport in the interest of the riders or the fans, this is because the body of people are formed by the speedway promotors who own the clubs.
attributes.additional_details:
Because the sport is run by people who own the clubs, decisions and rules are made individually to suit their needs, and what will make them make more money or save them loosing money. 

The pay and working conditions for riders are very poor, this is not what fans pay to see.

attributes.action: A Call to Action:  Raising Awareness of Mental Ill-health in Higher Education
attributes.background:
The government and higher education authorities must recognise and prioritise the 'student voice' in promoting mental ill-health in higher education. Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi

Please copy and paste the link below to read more.  

https://imhblog.wordpress.com/
attributes.additional_details:
There is no health without mental health (Department of Health, 2011) just as there may be no academic achievement without mental health.

Please sign the petition in support of this extremely important issue.

It is hoped that our collective signatures will prompt the government to recognise and debate the importance of actively promoting the awareness of mental ill-health in higher education.

Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi
Mental Health Nurse
PhD Student

attributes.action: Make co-operation with Trump administration conditional on human rights.
attributes.background:
Angela Merkel promised co-operation on the condition that âvalues of democracy, freedom and respect for the law and the dignity of man, independent of origin, skin colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation or political viewsâ were upheld.
The UK Government should publicly adopt the same stance.

attributes.action: Make .22 Rimfire Pistols legal for Sporting purposes on FAC Certificates
attributes.background: In 1997 The UK Labour party Prime minister Tony Blair brought in The Firearm Ammendment Act of 1997 Number 2 which banned all .22 rimfire pistols for section 1 holders. I feel like the ban was unessecary and pointless and I feel that we have been treated as gulity people but we are not.
attributes.additional_details: Whoever holds a section 1 licence should have any gun they wish. Because what doesn't make sense is that if 22 rimfire semi auto rifles are legal then why can't we own a 22 rimfire pistol. If we somehow stand up against anti gun people and prove to them of how guns are not evil people that are bad are evil. If you even don't have a licence but support this sport you can push us to victory and freedom for this sport and live in a country with zero threat.

attributes.action: The taxpayer should pay for the defence of our servicemen and women in court.
attributes.background: As government employees, members of the UK's Armed Forces who fought in Iraq, Afghanistan or elsehwere whilst serving the Crown, should not have to pay for their defence in court.
attributes.additional_details: If Mr Blair's defence is going to be borne by the taxpayer then so should our servicemen and women who have fought and served on the Crown and Governments behalf.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for travel time to be paid when part of the job
attributes.background:
In home care industry and possibly many other jobs, the travel time for the job is not always paid.
Carers are getting up early in the morning for shifts starting even at 6am and working until 14:00/15:00. The same carers will return to work typically 2 hours later, to finish their jobs after 22:00
attributes.additional_details:
This makes for most home carers really long shifts and they are only being paid the time they are at the clients, not the time spent to travel between their clients, which according to gov.uk is also working time.

https://www.gov.uk/maximum-weekly-working-hours/calculating-your-working-hours

Imagine being out of your home for more than 12 hours for the job and be paid for 7-8 hours (at best). This pushes the quality of life to a low end.

It should be a legal requirement to pay the travel time at the workerâs normal rate of pay. This should include travel time to and from home if the place of work is not a fixed one.

attributes.action: Make it law for MPs to see Constituents whether they support them or not
attributes.background: During the Waspi campaign M.P.s have refused to see their Constituents as they don't support the issue.Also, they did not hand in the paper petitions to the House of Commons 11/10/16 and other M.P.s had to do this for them

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on whether or not we want a Solent Combined Authority
attributes.background: The local authorities of these areas are proposing sweeping changes to the way local government works. This will result in the creation of a new Solent Combined Authority headed by an Elected Mayor.
attributes.additional_details:
An online consultation began on 22nd July 2016 with little account taken of the need for accessibility for those with disabilities. 
We note with concern that this consultation started during the busy summer holiday period when many people are away or otherwise occupied.This is a matter of considerable concern for residents of Portsmouth, Southampton and the IOW. It also disenfranchises many students who study in the two cities and on the island but may be away during the summer.

attributes.action: End the Breed Specific Legislation
attributes.background: BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This is a petition to end the BSL. A new law should be brought in to replace the Dangerous Dogs act to ensure responsibility for a dogâs behaviour is placed on the owner or person in charge of it.
attributes.additional_details: It is the owners responbility to control there own dog or a dog they are in charge of. Also to seek help if their dog or a dog they are in charge of shows signs of aggression or behavioural problems.

attributes.action: Teach sign language (makaton) to primary school children & teachers
attributes.background: I am mum to a child who cannot speak, we use makaton to communicate. My child was discriminated against at her primary school, who refused to teach makaton. Teaching Makaton would mean children/adults would be able to communicate throughout their life making society more inclusive & less frustrating
attributes.additional_details: My daughter signs to communicate. When we go out and she tries to communicate, everyone always asks me 'what is she saying'. Knowing just yes & no in sign & to understand children/adults with disabilities would make such a difference. Without better communication many people are trapped in their world. If we are accepting of people with disabilities why are we not teaching all children sign language to enable communication for all https://www.makaton.org/aboutMakaton/

attributes.action: Legally require force food suppliers to label all halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.background:
I am not Muslim, i do not wish to eat halal meat, l do not agree with it religiously & ethically, i support animal rights.
I have accidentally eaten halal meat and this caused me religious and ethical issues and has deeply offended me, i demand ALL shops clearly label halal blessed/slaughtered meat
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco- "we do not specify to suppliers whether halal practices should be followed"
M&S-  "we do not specify any religious practice as part of our sourcing policy so therefore do not label"

Sainsburys- "in NZ it is common for lamb to be blessed"

Morrisons- "all our lamb from NZ is pre-stunned and blessed"

Co-Op- "there is currently no UK wide labelling scheme"

ASDA- "No comment"

Waitrose- " there is currently no UK labelly scheme and we believe this is a matter where government should lead "

attributes.action: Increase funding for investigating tool theft for tradesmen.
attributes.background:
Yet to find a tradesman who hasn't had their tools stolen at some point in their life. It seems like there is very little investigation into tool theft and cases are quickly closed.

Took theft is extremely expensive for the victim and damages our careers and livelihoods.
attributes.additional_details: I want to see the police pay more attention to tool theft and harsher penalties for those caught handling stolen tools.

attributes.action: Government invokes article 50 by the end of 2016
attributes.background: As you all know the people of the UK voted to leave the EU on June 23rd 2016, the process can only begin after the Government has invoked Article 50. A few people who do not wish to accept that vote are calling for another referendum, we need to press ahead or we may cause civil unrest in the UK.

attributes.action: Scrap charges at hospital car parks.
attributes.background: It is unfair and at times a dangerous practice to charge.  It is an essential service and causes problems for visiting routine and emergency appointments.  It causes unnecessary hardship.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory all authorities scan all domestic pets!
attributes.background: Bodies working in the animal sector, such as vets & shelters, usually scan for a microchip. However this is not compulsory and there are other authorities who will not scan at all such as a number of councils. All authorities working with animals, by law, should be required to scan all domestic pets
attributes.additional_details:
Microchips in domestic pets were introduced so, should an animal be lost or found injured, an owner could be located and notified. 
There is no current legislation which states any authority who comes in to contact with animals has any legal obligation to scan them. 
Dogs and cats can be collected & disposed of by councils without having been scanned and owners will never be informed. This leads to great distress and upset when the owner has a right to be informed of the fate of their companion

attributes.action: Reject measures in the Digital Economy Bill to censor legal content online
attributes.background: The Digital Economy Bill has passed its third reading in the Commons. It includes measures to force Internet Service Providers to block pornographic websites which don't verify the age of users via intrusive means, and to censor legal content depicting sexual acts classified "non-conventional".
attributes.additional_details:
This amounts to intrusive and dangerous State censorship of legal content online.

While the Government may claim that the aim is solely to protect children from viewing adult content, the reality is that these measures are unnecessary - when ISPs already provide optional filters for such content, bring severe privacy risks, and establish the precedent and framework to allow the Government to censor legal online content of which it simply does not approve.

These measures must be rejected.

attributes.action: End the triple lock on State Pension increases that is planned until 2020
attributes.background: The triple lock on the State Pension means it will increase by 2.5%, inflation or earnings (whichever is highest) each year until 2020. As the UK has voted for Brexit, and a recession is likely, it is not fair that pensioners should be protected when those of working age are not.

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: A confirmatory referendum on the UK's membership of the EU should be held.
attributes.background:
1. There was a margin of 3.8% in favour of leaving the EU.  This is within the margin of error.
2. As the first referendum is advisory, Parliament is entitled to ask the electorate to confirm its decision.  It is more democratic rather than less to ask for a confirmatory referendum.

attributes.action: Increase standard benefit amount for ESA, & improve screening process for PIP.
attributes.background:
Thousands of people are too scared to apply for benefits, due to fear of losing current benefits or being taken to court 

The amount for ESA is Â£57 per week. PIP is awarded if you qualify at a testing centre, where 'not looking tired enough' will get your application declined.
attributes.additional_details:
I am part of a fibromyalgia support page, and a bipolar support page. Both of these pages are full of people who are applying for PIP and ESA, and being turned down due to 'not looking tired enough' (fibromyalgia sufferer), 'being able to be woken up by strangers at their stop on a bus' (narcolepsy sufferer), 'being mobile' when the person has to use an electric wheelchair paid for by themselves due to benefit refusal (fibromyalgia sufferer) 

Austerity is being applied in the wrong places.

attributes.action: Follow France and force shops to donate food waste to charities.
attributes.background:
Every year in the UK 18 million tonnes of food end up in landfill.

Approx 1/3 from producers/ supply chain, 1/3 from retail and 1/3 from households.

Annual value : Â£23 BILLION 

Disposal costs to business passed on to consumers in higher prices, landfill costs in local taxes â less income
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/may/22/uk-tops-chart-of-eu-food-waste

http://www.foodawarecic.org.uk/stats-2/

attributes.action: A second EU referendum including EU nationals living and working in the UK
attributes.background: 3 millions EU nationals live and work in the UK, contribute to the UK economy and social fabric, pay UK taxes. The results of the EU referendum matter a great deal to them, their (often British) spouses and children. Yet they have been effectively muzzled by voting laws. This needs to be put right.
attributes.additional_details:
A similar petition was dismissed on the following grounds: 
- "historical ties with Irish and Commonwealth citizens resident in the UK". There are also historical ties between the UK and the EU. The UK joined in 1961, 4 years after the Treaty of Rome (free movement of workers).
- "usual practice for referendums in other EU states". True - however at Â£1,000 the cost of applying for UK citizenship is out of line with other EU states (e.g. cost of applying for French citizenship = â¬55).

attributes.action: Make more treatments available on the NHS for Lipoedema patients.
attributes.background: Lipoedema is a genetic adipose tissue disorder which causes patients legs & arms to grow largely out of proportion. This can be an incredibly painful, embarrassing & debilitating condition. It's estimated to affect 11% of women worldwide
attributes.additional_details: The only way to effectively treat this condition is surgery. It doesn't just effect women, lipoedema can effect men as well. Patients with Lipoedema have painful, enlarged, lumpy, misshaped and often badly bruised arms and legs. Currently patients are left to suffer as the disfiguration of the limbs becomes more pronounced, the pain increases and their mobility and enjoyment of everyday activities decreases. Please sign this petition and get the Lipoedema patients the treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: UK Government to Urge La Republic Du Cameroun to hold a Referendum in Cameroon
attributes.background: In September of 1961 the British Government refused to grant British Southern Cameroon independence as an autonomous state but rather transferred the baton of 'Master' to La Republic Du Cameroun that had become independent in 1960, hence refusing the people of BSC the right to self determination.
attributes.additional_details: Through a carefully crafted Referendum in which the people of S.Cameroon were refused a third option 'Independence' through the UN's fear of not creating many small states, The people of British S. Cameroons are still suffering the slavish effects of colonialism under La Republic. After Almost 55 years of marginalization, brutal impunity and gross miscarriage of injustice we the people want an autonomous state and it is incumbent on the UK Government to help our people regain their Liberties

attributes.action: Make it law for the tethering of horses to be a criminal offence.
attributes.background: A tethered horse is a horse on a length of chain. Unable to move beyond the confines of the chain and often without shelter, sufficient grazing and water. Many are tethered 24/7 and spend their days going round and round in circles. They are not living, just existing. You can help end this.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to see instances of tethered horses and how  despondent and resigned to their fate they look then visit the Facebook page of  Save the Papermill Horses.

attributes.action: Abolish same roof rule and 1979 rule for historic sexual abuse victims
attributes.background: If you were abused by a family member living in the same household the Ministry of Justice thinks that's ok. If your abuse ended prior to October 1979 that's ok too. The CICA will not pay out any form of compensation if you fall into either of these categories, an unfair and unjust rule.
attributes.additional_details: My father and mother were recently jailed for what he did to me as a child I and my sisters were told to make a claim for compensation. We did but as my abuse ended in July 1979 and it was my father that sexually abused me the law says it was ok and I am entitled to nothing. This is not about the money this is about another slap in the face for abuse victims coming forward it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd as home secretary
attributes.background: We the 17 million who voted to leave,have no confidence in amber rudd as home secretary..Her performance during the debates was appalling and very childish..We expect a brexit home secretary asap.Who will deliver what we have asked for and will be fit for the job.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa may must accept and do the will of the undersigned ..We should of had a vote for who runs our government.

attributes.action: Reform the democratic system to work honestly for the people it serves.
attributes.background:
Many people voted for Brexit to regain power. The âremainâ people want the same. It unites us both. We all want to have control over our own lives. Primarily this depends on a government genuinely working for us. This requires a total reformation of our systems of democracy. 
So we demand,
attributes.additional_details:
Proportional representation.
A published declaration of party policies/intentions before general elections, which must be held.
Early general elections called if those promises are broken.
An elected upper house.
A cap on donations of Â£5000 - instead state funding for a system owned by the people it serves and policies not able to be bought.
A law ensuring the media correct any inaccuracies or misleading statements on the same page, fitting format with the original article, with an apology.

attributes.action: That MPs should debate and vote on an inquiry into the events at Orgreve
attributes.background: they has been a lot of distrust between workers and the police due to the suspicion that the events on 18 June 1984 between police and pickets at a British Steel Corporation plant in Orgreave, South Yorkshire.

attributes.action: Direct Councils to use the Mobile Home powers devolved to them, without option.
attributes.background: A 'criminal element' have been acquiring Sites. They use brutal intimidation to frighten elderly residents and they ignore any regulations. Although Councils have enormous powers under Planning and Licencing  they are reluctant to get involved, even when there is overwhelming evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The main legislation is the 1960 Caravan Act, the 1983  Mobile Home Act and the 2013 Mobile Home Act. Councils have been lethargic and even negligent in their policing of these Acts. 

There is a Parliamentary Working Group monitoring the 2013 Act, but they are not going to report until July 2017. The legislation must be made to work now and the rouges must either change their ways, or be relieved of the ownership of their Sites. Too many elderly residents are suffering hardship and abuse.

attributes.action: Referendums should require a two thirds majority to mandate any change
attributes.background: Without a clear majority referendums can be divisive and lead to uncertain outcomes. Any mandate for a change in a referendum should therefore require the support of at least two thirds of those voting and over 50% of those eligible to vote.
attributes.additional_details: British political parties generally require two thirds of the those voting to approve any constitutional change, as do many democratic nations.  This requirement acts a s a safeguard to ensure any change is clearly wanted and does not lead to future instability. A referendum should only be held to deal with important issues which are in themselves likely to have constitutional implications.  So it is reasonable to expect any vote for change made via a referendum to be similarly safeguarded.

attributes.action: Care Home Crisis: Reinstate our licence to continue sponsoring current migrants
attributes.background: ARMSCARE is a care home group, whose licence to sponsor skilled migrant workers was revoked and despite efforts to remedy any errors, our skilled migrant workforce were given 60 days to leave the country. Ensuring our current staff stay, will guarantee the best quality of service to our residents.
attributes.additional_details:
We are an open and honest care home group that aims to provide the best quality of care to our residents and by forcing our staff to leave; it removes the very essence of quality and skill from our core business. 

Recruiting local staff or staff willing to relocate to Norfolk is proving to be virtually impossible because villages such as Docking do not have a regular mobile phone signal, let alone any regular public transport for commuters.
For further information please see: www.armscare.co.uk

attributes.action: Equal voting rights for EU citizens resident in the UK - Void the referendum
attributes.background:
British citizens who lived in the EU for more than 15 years were not permitted a vote. As such parity should exist for EU citizens who have lived and contributed to British society for more than 15 years.
On these grounds the referendum to leave the EU should be re-run to allow a fair vote for all.
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens are currently permitted to vote in Local and European Elections regardless of how long they have been resident and paid taxes for, but have been blocked from voting in Parliamentary Elections. There are many EU citizens who have lived in the UK for longer than 15 years, as are there Briish Citizens who have lived elsewhere in the EU. Both groups were discriminated by not being allowed to vote on their future on June the 23rd 2016 in the Referendum to Remain or Leave the EU.

attributes.action: Ensure Local Authorities maintain Road Crossing Patrols for schools
attributes.background: Norfolk County Council are trying to cut certain school crossing patrols from operating, because they deem they do not meet certain threshold criteria and are therefore not necessary. It is another cost-cutting motion, which will see lives of pupils and parents crossing the road put at higher risk.
attributes.additional_details: What price can we put on a child's safety?

attributes.action: Make education about domestic violence part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: Domestic violence is a huge hidden issue within the UK. Everyday, individuals in harmful relationships are physically and emotionally abused, which directly impacts the lives of children involved.Therefore education on this issue could provide a lifeline for those impacted, and prevent future abuse.

attributes.action: Delete "journalism, art or literature" exemptions from the FOI Act
attributes.background: Schedule 1, Part VI of the Freedom Of Information Act 2000 lists a number of organisations granted special exemption, where the Act only applies to information "held for purposes other than those of journalism, art or literature". This is misused to reject ANY FOI requests they'd rather not answer.
attributes.additional_details:
They use a very loose interpretation of this exemption to support these rejections, as everything they do can be linked back to one of these three categories.

They make frequent use of the Act to interrogate other public sector organisations in their journalistic research, yet use the JAoL clause to shield themselves from similar investigation.

We therefore request that these exemptions be deleted from the FOI Act, leaving them open to the same level of scrutiny as other public bodies.
